bibl.title: Two Ptolemaic Stelae for the Sacred Lion of Leonton Polis (Tell Moqdam).
bibl.note: 1. Stela of Kleopatra in the Peking University Museum. Inv. 95.0879. Bought in Egypt (probably in 1906) by Duan Fang, ambassador of the Chinese emperor. Inscriptions in hieroglyphs and Demotic. - 2. Stela of a Ptolemy in the Louvre. Inv. E 14226. Offered by Paul Perdrizet in 1931. Inscription in hieroglyphs. - Table of similar limestone stelae representing a pharaoh offering to a lion god on a pedestal [Nos 1-19, some of them with Greek text]. - Mentions a letter in the Zenon archive (P. Lond. VII, 1938), which oddly corresponds with the date given on a stela in Leipzig (inv. 1668).
